name: XVerExtensionElementDefinition.binding.additional
title: Cross-Version Extension for FHIR R5:ElementDefinition.binding.additional compared to FHIR R4
description: R5 `ElementDefinition.binding.additional` does not appear in the target and has no mapping for `ElementDefinition`.

element.short: Additional Bindings - more rules about the binding
element.definition: Additional bindings that help applications implementing this element. Additional bindings do not replace the main binding but provide more information and/or context.
element.comment: R5 `ElementDefinition.binding.additional` does not appear in the target and has no mapping for `ElementDefinition`.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: maximum | minimum | required | extensible | candidate | current | preferred | ui | starter | component
element.definition: The use of this additional binding.
element.comment: Conformance bindings are in addition to the base binding, not instead of it.

element.short: The value set for the additional binding
element.definition: The valueSet that is being bound for the purpose.

element.short: Documentation of the purpose of use of the binding
element.definition: Documentation of the purpose of use of the bindingproviding additional information about how it is intended to be used.

element.short: Qualifies the usage - jurisdiction, gender, workflow status etc.
element.definition: Qualifies the usage of the binding. Typically bindings are qualified by jurisdiction, but they may also be qualified by gender, workflow status, clinical domain etc. The information to decide whether a usege context applies is usually outside the resource, determined by context, and this might present challenges for validation tooling.
element.comment: This specification does not define exactly how the context is determined for the usage; typically, this will be described in implementation guides.

element.short: Whether binding can applies to all repeats, or just one
element.definition: Whether the binding applies to all repeats, or just to any one of them. This is only relevant for elements that can repeat.
element.comment: A common pattern is to make a conformance binding to all repeats, and then make a binding that one of the repeats must conform to.

extension.valueString: The use of an additional binding.

binding.description: Allowed values based on differential of http://hl7.org/fhir/ValueSet/additional-binding-purpose|5.0.0 compared with R4
